# cpp-json functions.

= Introduction =

Here is a list of all functions found in the cpp-json library:

= Details =

  * `template <class In> json::value json::parse(In first, In last);`
  * `json::value parse(std::istream &is);`

these are the main parsing functions of the library, pass it two iterators or a `std::istream` representing the text to parse.

  * `bool json::is_string(const value &v);`
  * `bool json::is_bool(const value &v);`
  * `bool json::is_number(const value &v);`
  * `bool json::is_object(const value &v);`
  * `bool json::is_array(const value &v);`
  * `bool json::is_null(const value &v);`

these will test if a `json::value` object is of a given type.

  * `std::string json::to_string(const value &v);`
  * `bool json::to_bool(const value &v);`
  * `double json::to_number(const value &v);`

attempts to convert a `json::value` to a basic type. May throw `invalid_type_cast` if it fails.

  * `size_t json::size(const value &v);`

returns the size of a `json::value` which is an array. Or 0 for any other type.
